Subjective: Hard stools, difficulty passing for 3 months. Bowel movements every 2-3 days. Abdominal pain, cramps, painful on pressure. Bloated/swollen stomach. Eats little, no change in habits. Underweight, no further weight loss. Meds: Olive oil (temporary relief). Negatives: No blood in stool, no change in urination, regular periods. No other family members with similar bowel problems (sister has ulcerative colitis, but different symptoms). ICE: Concerned if serious, wants to soften stool. Impact on daily life: Not explicitly stated, but difficulty and pain imply impact.
Objective: Abdomen: Normal bowel sounds. Bloated/distended. Varying tympani on percussion. Sensitive/painful on palpation in lower left quadrant, dampening on percussion there. Renal lodges non-tender. Upper abdomen non-tender. Lower right abdomen non-tender.
Assessment: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) with constipation predominance. Ruled out: Serious conditions (no alarm bells), ulcerative colitis.
Plan: Explanation: IBS (constipation type), common, causes hard stools, pain, bloating.
Meds: Psyllium fiber sachets daily with plenty of water, prescribed for 6 weeks.
Safety net: Contact if abdominal pain worsens, fever, or significant blood in stool.
Discuss dietitian referral for underweight next time.
